subject: Re: [junit] Re: Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: We re currently using it at work to run individual tests. -Eric ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Yahoo! Autos - Get free
messageBody:
We're currently using it at work to run individual
tests.

-Eric

--- parul_49 <parul_49@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@y..., Mike Clark <mike@c...> wrote:
> > parul_49 wrote:
> >
> > >Hi,
> > >I am trying to write Junit test for some of the
> classes.
> > >This is my code :
> > > public static Test suite()
> > > {
> > > TestSuite suite = new
> TestSuite(GetBanBillSummaryTest.class);
> > > return suite;
> > > }
> > >
> > > public static void main(String args[])
> > > {
> > > //junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> > > junit.swingui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> > > }
> > >
> >
> > Most folks generally don't use the SwingUI in the
> main method, so
> it's a
> > little different.
> >
> > This will work:
> >
> > junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(Your.class);
> >
> > Mike
>
>
>
> Thanks for the prompt reply.
> Why do u say that most people do not use the swingui
> in the main
> method, how else do they use it? Is it a bad
> practise to use it?
>
>
>
>
>
